Great game with friends.
Nice Game
Portal 2 is one of my favorite games. It's very well written, designed, and developed. The storyline flows with the ending of Portal 1, and is quite enjoyable. Definitely recommend!

[h1] Portal 2 [/h1]
This is one of the most fun puzzle games I've ever played.  Thinking with portals is mind-boggling and this sequel expands upon everything that made the first game so great.  More test chambers, more story, more character, there's just about more of everything here, and it's welcomed.  [spoiler] Wheatley's and GLaDOS's dialogue is hilarious, and Cave Johnson gives some eye-opening backstory to Aperture Laboratories [/spoiler].  The new test elements are implemented well.  Chapter 6, however, is a little slow at the beginning because you're just looking for portalable walls and such.  Overall an amazing game.

De ska vara s√• pass kluriga att man k√§nner sig n√∂jd n√§r man klarar dem, men inte vara s√• sv√•ra att det k√§nns som att sl√• huvudet i en betongv√§gg. Jag tycker att Portal 2 har hittat precis r√§tt! Sv√•righeten √∂kas lagom fort och extra komplexiteter inf√∂rs efter hand i ett tempo som g√∂r att det inte k√§nns forcerat men inte heller enahanda. This is one of the best games i've ever played. there is so much content in it, lots of little secrets, and it looks beautiful. The voice acting in the game is spctacular and the puzzles are challenging.

[h1]Portal 2[/h1]

[b]Das Spielprinzip:[/b]

Das Spielprinzip besteht darin Portale zu setzen, um so zum Ausgang eines Raums zu kommen. Wenn man in ein Portal reingeht kommt man am anderen wieder raus. Komplexer wird das ganze nun noch dadurch, dass man die Portale nur auf ein bestimmtes Material platzieren kann. Au√üerdem gibt es Katapultplattformen, Lichtbr√ºcken, Transportr√∂hren, W√ºrfel und Laser, mit denen man bestimmte Sachen aktivieren oder erreichen kann. 

[b]Die Grafik:[/b]

 Die Grafik basiert auf der Source Engine und hat somit schon ein paar Jahre auf dem Buckel. Dennoch ist die Grafik in Portal 2 sch√∂n anzusehen und erf√ºllt ihren Zweck -  denn mehr muss sie auch nicht.

[b]Sound:[/b]

Die Synchro von Portal 2 ist einfach nur super. Es gibt zwar nicht viele Sprecher bzw. Rollen die eine Stimme bekommen, dennoch ist die Synchro im englischen wie auch im deutschen gut gelungen und kann mit  Sprach- und Wortwitzen, sowie mit einem fantastischen Humor punkten. 
Der Soundtrack ist ebenfalls gelungen und passt zur Atmosph√§re des Spiels. Auch die Sounds der Umgebung sie gut gelungen.

[b]Gameplay:[/b]

Das Spiel spielt sich aus der Ego-Perspektive und hat die Standardm√§√üige WASD-Shootersteuerung. Portale lassen sich √ºber die linke und rechte Maustaste platzieren. Die Steuerung ist also sehr simpel gehalten.

Das Balancing ist ebenfalls gut. Man wird langsam an das Spiel heran gef√ºhrt und kommt von leichten in immer schwerer werdende Testkammern.

[b]Umfang:[/b]

Das Spiel bietet einen Singelplayer und einen spa√üigen Coop-Modus. Zudem bietet Portal 2 die M√∂glichkeit eines Editors, mit welchem man eigene Level erstellen und √ºber den Steam-Workshop mit anderen Spielern teiln kann. Man kann so also einiges an Spielzeit aus diesesm Spiel rausholen.

[b]Leveldesign:[/b]

Das Leveldesign ist genial. Die Level sind oft sehr simpel aufgebaut, jedoch muss man meist um die Ecke denken und ein wenig r√§tseln um auf die L√∂sung des Levels zu kommen. Das macht durchaus Spa√ü und bleibt motivierend.

[b]Fazit:[/b]

Portal 2 kann ich jedem empfehlen, der Spa√ü an R√§tseln hat oder einfach Lust hat, einen Spa√üigen Coop-Modus und Humorvollen Singleplayer zu erleben.

Juegazo.

Hmm... Portal 2... Where to start? This game has everything you could ever ask for in a good game. I have played the Singleplayer story about 7-8 times now (including playing on the PS3) and I still haven't gotten bored. Moving on to the Steam version was a great idea. It has custom maps, you can make your own test chambers with the Perpetual Testing Initiative, and you can enjoy the fun with a friend. This is a big step up from the original Portal, with a longer story, more and interesting characters, and more fun in-game mechanics. It is always fun to come back to the main story and re-live some of the best moments like... Well I shouldn't spoil it for you. Just get the game, you won't regret it.

10/10
Very Nice game that I got. Makes your brain smarter as you try to think really hard on how to pass a level.

I started playing and was immediately drawn into the setting and storyline. Art direction is some of the best I've seen. A real treat. 

The turret's lines are adorable. I sneak up behind one and pick it up: "Who are you?" It asks. It was here that I fell in love with this game.

I hope there will be a Portal III.

I played this game on 360 but i got this on a sale for the custom maps. Very good.

I'm ashamed that I haven't played this sooner. 

Top 5 game all time for me. Right behind 007 Goldeneye(N64), FFXII(PS2), Killer Instinct Gold(N64), and Double Dragon (arcade). Complete Pro job all the way through, even the credits are very clever. Most of the puzzles in the beginning are fairly easy but still a blast to play. Towards the end my C-grade intellect needed a walkthrough 2 or 3 times. 

Good looking graphics, great voice overs, actually a bit of a plot as well and very well scripted. All this and I still have yet to play it in co-op. 

There are a great many games out there I'm afraid to beat because I don't want them to end. I'm one of those people that once I beat a game, it usually loses its allure. This one had such suspense I couldn't wait to beat it to see what happens. Fantastic ending. Totally worth it! Doesn't matter the price, this is a must play.

This game is Portal, but done way better than the first one. Keep in mind, I did like it, but I did not like the fact that it had no co-op support and you could beat it in a day. This game fixed that by adding co-op, creatable test chambers, and much more replayability.

Definitely a must own for any Steam user

I think I enjoyed listening to GLaDOS & Wheatley talk more then doing the puzzles, having said that the puzzles are challenging but never to hard in a sense that it would feel unfair, even down the course of the game it never grows stall, with new ways to solve puzzles such as the colours being blue that makes you jump, orange that increases your speed and white that helps you put portals in different areas, all are like paint splattering all over the ground, or getting gravity portals that either push you forward or backwards, lasers and much, much more, honestly it was great how it all ended and I don't actually want them to make Portal 3 as Portal 2's ending was perfect, great game overall and definitely something everyone should at least try once to see what all the fuss is about
